moves.1. e4:
Let Sleeping Threats Lie.

I tend to be a very blunt player. I'm not subtle enough and I tend to fret overly about material, so just occasionally when I get it right it feels very good.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Bd6 3. Bc4 c6 4. d4 exd4: Powerful central development, now lets see what else we can bring in....
moves.10... Bc5 11. Nf7+ Qxf7: Now that came as a major shock to me. It wasn't what I was expecting at all.
moves.12. Bxf7 Bxd4 13. Bxd4 Nf6 14. Bxf6+: Quite happy to break up pawn formations.
moves.14... gxf6 15. Nc3 Rh7 16. Bg6 Rg7 17. h: Not sure what he hopes to gain from that one. It makes my life a lot easier by threatening to queen....
moves.20. exf5 Na6 21. f6 Re6: Now normally I would have gone for the exchange, but still in the mood to let the threats develop and my opponent to worry himself.
moves.22. Rhd1 Kc7 23. Rd6xd7+ Kc8: k-b8 would have saved him, debateable for how long but even so....
moves.24. Rd7d8+ Kc7 25. Rd1d7#: Its a salutary lesson to me not to always go charging in but sometimes to let my opponent worry himself to death, heck enough have done it to me, you think I'd have learnt by now ;-)
